poem:
**Master Blaster Unplugged**

Four notes spark uprisings,  
unison joy like apples  
tipping from the cart.  
Soul-funk-pop child's hands  
rummage through time's toy chest,  
each note a bright riot  
echoed through bodies swaying,  
unfurling flags of Marley's breath;  
a concert of shared hearts  
in sync with rhythm's embrace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stevie Wonder review – a riotously joyful celebration The concert is just minutes old when the crowd recognise the tell-tale first four notes of Stevie Wonder’s 1980 Bob Marley eulogy Master Blaster (Jammin’), and instantaneously rise to their feet in unison and pure joy. For almost two and a half hours, the soul-funk-pop legend rifles through his back catalogue with the glee of a small child deciding which toy to play with next. At various". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
